multiplechoiceresponse.p: Which of the following is a key difference between Redis Pub/Sub and Redis Streams?
multiplechoiceresponse.label: Pick one answer

choicegroup.choice: Streams allow multiple clients to receive data data. Pub/Sub does not.
Pub/Sub allows multiple clients to connect and receive data, but streams does not.
Streams store data in memory for later consumption by clients. Pub/Sub doesn't store any messages.
Pub/Sub stores data in memory for later consumption by clients. Streams doesn't store any messages.

div.p: Redis Pub/Sub is fire-and-forget: if clients are not connected when a message is published, they will never receive it. Streams are persistent, meaning that clients can connect and request all messages ever published to the stream.
